reviewText: I enjoyed this DVD, not really knowing quite what to expect by the title.  Found myself captivated by the whole story and the actors portrayed these characters in a very convincing way. Eric Roberts as Bill Bonanno was very appealing  and  convincing. He always managed to seduce Rosalie, played by Nancy McKeon- his young innocent wife who eventually finds the strength to make a life of her own and support her family..... It's amazing that they eventually stayed together and seemed to be still in love over many years.

reviewText: This made for tv mini-series is a good movie about the Bonanno family.  While there is good information and scenes regarding the crime family and their history, it also tells the story of the wife of Salvatore (Bill) Bonanno who married into the family (she was a daughter of the Profaci crime family, was a bit naive about the goings on of the mafia families and was forced to sacrifice heavily when her husband went to prison and the Bonanno family basically was financially ruined.  She kept her family together and they have thrived in the non-mafia world.

reviewText: This TV movie flick pertains to an era, a culture, and an often overlooked side of organized crime. Set during the 1950s and ‘60s, LOVE, HONOR & OBEY: THE LAST MAFIA MARRIAGE looks at a very human story against the backdrop of violence and crime.Both Rosalie Profaci (Nancy McKeon) and Bill Bonanno (Eric Roberts) are from prominent Mafia families, and their marriage cements an alliance between the two.Despite their connections, they are happily living their lives outside of the crime world, until Bill is forced to take over the family business. Slowly his business begins to overtake his life, and Rosalie attempts to keep their family together and shield them from the harsh realities of their situation.This drama film takes me back to memory lane to when I was 21 years old and we had all those budget cuts going on from the recession we had back in 1992-1993 when Bill Clinton was President.
Title: N/A
